bio:treatment.discussion: Disceliaceae is widely distributed in the Northern Hemisphere but always rare. It is predominantly temperate, but also boreal at lower elevations.

references.reference: Duckett, J. G. and S. Pressl. 2003. Studies of protonemal morphogenesis in mosses. IX. Discelium nudum: Exquisite pioneer of unstable clay banks. J. Bryol. 25: 241–245.
Shaw, A. J. and B. H. Allen. 1985. Anatomy and morphology of the peristome in Discelium nudum (Musci: Disceliaceae). Bryologist 88: 263–267.
